snippet: Nadzeya Ostapchuk tested positive for an anabolic steroid, the International Olympic Committee said on Monday, making Valerie Adams of New Zealand the winner.
abstract: Belarus shot-putter Nadzeya Ostapchuk is stripped of her gold medal after testing positive for an anabolic steroid; the gold medal is retroactively awarded to New Zealand's Valerie Adams, the defending Olympic champion; Russia's Evgeniia Kolodko moves up to silver and China's Lijiao Gong will receive a bronze medal.
lead_paragraph: Nadzeya Ostapchuk tested positive for an anabolic steroid, the International Olympic Committee said on Monday, making Valerie Adams of New Zealand the winner.

headline.seo: Nadzeya Ostapchuk of Belarus Stripped of Olympic Gold Medal for Doping
headline.main: Positive Test Costs Shot-Putter Gold Medal
headline.print_headline: Belarus Shot-Putter Stripped of Gold Medal
